metadata.Title: CVE-2018-0497 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ARM mbed TLS before 2.12.0, before 2.7.5, and before 2.1.14 allows remote attackers to achieve partial plaintext recovery (for a CBC based ciphersuite) via a timing-based side-channel attack. This vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix (with a wrong SHA-384 calculation) for CVE-2013-0169.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0497` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto0 - 2.2.1-2ubuntu0.3
libmbedtls10 - 2.2.1-2ubuntu0.3
libmbedx509-0 - 2.2.1-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-2ubuntu0.3').
